@yourmomisretard No, idiot. It's not their actions alone that dictate whether or not you are respectable, it's how you react to it. If they do something like that and you do approve, then it is low testosterone. If they do something like that and you don't approve, then it isn't low testosterone. Their actions are reflective of their character, not yours. True, you don't own them, you don't need to. It's about the mentality, there should be an innate internal resistance to those kind of events. Funnily enough, there actually is. Even normalfag dudebros have some informal guidelines like the "Bro Code" that stipulate that sisters and ex-girlfriends are off-limits because they clearly get pissed off at the notion of it even if they aren't actually in a relationship where that would be a cheating scenario. I imagine if close female childhood friends were more of a thing in reality, they'd also be included in that "code".

@rello "Anyone in real life who doesn't get enraged at the thought of his sister or childhood friend fucking some random fag must have low testosterone." So fucking retarded. With this logic, every male must have low testosterone or a cuckold because your sister or your childhood friend fucks some "random" fag at one point of their life. You don't fucking OWN them just because they are your sister/childhood friend. Any woman can fuck whoever they want to regardless of your perspective IN REAL LIFE, unless you're in a relationship. I completely agree with everything you said except this last one. You fucking sound like an incel. I agree that a story can be NTR if the narrative makes the MC feels like his sister/mother/aunt/childhoodfriend/girlfriend/wife/etc getting NTR'ed. But IRL, does this logic work? Big fat NO. Oh and I'm not putting what you said out of context, cause you yourself had said "in real life".

Retards. The "netorare" tag is applicable so long as there is a clear narrative of a female being stolen emotionally or mentally from a prominent male character. This is why it can be tagged in instances where even if it's a childhood friend or relative who the male has no obvious attraction to, if another man fucks them and the narrative blatantly recognises that, then it's netorare. Anyone in real life who doesn't get enraged at the thought of his sister or childhood friend fucking some random fag must have low testosterone.
